problem_text:
Line Segments in the Boundary of a Convex Body

PROBLEM:
Is there a convex body C in E^n such that every direction in E^n is realized by some line segment in the boundary of C?

Let S denote the unit sphere {x ∈ E^n : ||x|| = 1}, and let D_C be the set of all s ∈ S for which the segment [0, s] is parallel to some segment in the boundary of C. Then D_C is an Fσ set in S. When n = 2, D_C is countable. It seems “intuitively obvious” that for arbitrary n, D_C must be of the ﬁrst category in S, and the (n − 1)-dimensional measure of D_C is equal to zero. For n = 3, this has been proved by McMinn [1].
